perturbation.original_text: 13. Insurance: During the term of this Agreement, and before any sponsorship or promotional activities are conducted under this Agreement, Company shall obtain and maintain at its expense, Commercial General Liability Insurance coverage with an insurance carrier with a Best’s rating of A+. The insurance shall be in an amount of: $2,000,000 per occurrence and $2,000,000 aggregate with a $2,000,000 aggregate for products and completed operations. The Association must be a named additional insured, and shall be provided at least 30 days’ notice for cancellation of policy and 10 days’ notice for non-payment of premium. Such insurance shall be primary and non-contributory.
perturbation.changed_text: 13. Insurance: During the term of this Agreement, and before any sponsorship or promotional activities are conducted under this Agreement, Company shall obtain and maintain at its expense, Commercial General Liability Insurance coverage. The Association must be a named additional insured, and shall be provided at least 30 days’ notice for cancellation of policy and 10 days’ notice for non-payment of premium. Such insurance shall be primary and non-contributory.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific insurance coverage amounts, the contract becomes ambiguous. While it still mandates insurance, the lack of defined amounts creates uncertainty and makes it difficult to enforce the insurance requirement, as the 'appropriate' coverage is no longer clear. Later sections referencing the insurance obligation now lack a concrete definition.

perturbation.original_text:
E. Relationship Structure & Payment Schedule
Company agrees to pay to the Association the cash rights fee in the amount of $150,000 for this Sponsorship Agreement.
Payments to Association shall be payable according to the following schedule:
Year 1 - Due: December 31, 2018 - $50,000
Year 2 - Due: December 31, 2019 - $75,000
Remaining Balance Due: March 30, 2020 - $25,000
perturbation.changed_text:
E. Relationship Structure & Payment Schedule
Company agrees to pay to the Association the cash rights fee for this Sponsorship Agreement.
Payments to Association shall be payable according to the following schedule:
Year 1 - Due: December 31, 2018
Year 2 - Due: December 31, 2019
Remaining Balance Due: March 30, 2020
perturbation.explanation: Removing the amount to pay of the Sponsorship Agreement creates a contradiction. The first sentance say there is an amount to pay, but the following section doesn't specify that amount. Therefore, there is an uncertainty about the amount.

perturbation.original_text:
ATTACHMENT B
Use of the Association’s Marks
Any use of the Association’s Marks requires the review and approval of the Association. Any modification to taglines or to the
‘locked up’ imagery (Association brand and Cause brand) also requires review and written approval by the Association to ensure
that with any modification, there is prominent proximity between the brands.
Approved Association Cause or Activity Marks: “American Diabetes Association Stop Diabetes®” and “Tour de Cure®” and
“Tour de Cure ‘year’®” - as logos change, attachments shall be added to this contract
PROMOTIONAL SUPPORTER
NATIONAL SPONSOR
Get Fit Don’t Sit Day®
perturbation.changed_text:
ATTACHMENT B
Use of the Association’s Marks
Any use of the Association’s Marks requires the review and approval of the Association. Any modification to taglines or to the
‘locked up’ imagery (Association brand and Cause brand) also requires review and written approval by the Association to ensure
that with any modification, there is prominent proximity between the brands.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the list of Approved Association Cause or Activity Marks, the contract becomes ambiguous. While the first sentence of the attachment mentions that use of the Association's marks requires the review and approval of the Association, there is now no guideline on the approved logos. Later sections referencing the Association Marks now lack a concrete definition of approved material.
